intro: Pavetta quasidigita, commonly known as the African pavetta, is a shrub native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of white or pink flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Its fruit is a small, capsule that contains several seeds.
